method.name: Mix butter and sugar until smooth.
Mix espresso powder with warm water in a separate bowl.
Mix the eggs into the butter and sugar mixture one at a time.
Mix flour with cocoa powder in a separate bowl.
Add the mixed espresso and vanilla to the butter mixture and stir well.
Pour the melted chocolate to this mixture and incorporate well.
Gently stir in the mixed flour, choclate chips and chopped nuts until they are evenly incorporated with the mixture.
Preheat the oven to 175 degrees Celcius
Transfer the mixture onto a tray lined with parchment paper and bake for 40 minutes.
Allow the brownies to cool completely before cutting them to your preffered size.
Add the butter and chopped chocolate in a bowl.
Heat the heavy cream in a saucepan till it simmers.
Pour the heated heavy cream over the butter and chocolate and let it rest for about 5 minutes.
Stir the ganache until its well-combined and smooth.
Dip the cut brownies with ganache and serve.
Add water and butter to a pan and heat till it simmers.
Remove the pan from the stove and mix in the flour till it forms a dough.
Heat the dough on low heat for about 5 minutes while mixing it well and then let it cool down completely.
Mix the eggs to the dough one at a time by stirring them in well.
Pipe the mixture onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and brush the eclairs with water.
preheat the oven to 210 degrees Celcius, and bake the eclairs for 10 minutes. Reduce the temperature to 180 degrees Celcius and bake for another 20 minutes.
After baking, remove the eclairs from the parchment paper and make holes at their base to pipe in the pastry cream.
Combine the sugar, cornstarch, and vanilla extract with the egg yolks.
Add 1/2 cup milk to the egg yolk mixture and stir well.
Add remaining milk and the egg yolk mixture in a saucepan and cook over medium heat.
When the pastry cream thickens and starts bubbling, mix in the butter.
Pour the pastry cream onto a bowl, line the top with cling film, and refrigerate it until it cools down.
Pipe the eclairs with the chilled pastry cream.
Add  butter and chopped chocolocate in a bowl.
Heat the heavy cream in a saucepan till it simmers.
Pour the heated heavy cream over the chocolate and let it rest for about 5 to 10 minutes before stirring it till it becomes smooth.
Dip the pastry cream-filled eclairs with the ganache and serve.
Cream the butter and sugar in a large bowl until it becomes light and fluffy.
Incorporate the flour into the butter mixture until the mixture becomes crumbly, yet holds together when pressed.
Press the mixture onto a parchment-lined tray and level it using a spoon. use a fork to mark holes randomly on the crust after levelling it.
Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celcius and bake the crust for 20-25 minutes.
Place all the ingredients in a saucepan and cook over medium heat.
Stir continuously until the mixture boils and and keep cooking it for 5 more minutes after it starts boiling.
Pour the prepared caramel over the crust and bake it for another 12-15 minutes at 180 degrees Celcius.
Melt the chocolate and butter over a double boiler.
After the baked caramel and crust cools slightly, spread the chocolate topping evenly and refrigerate it until the chocolate sets, before cutting them.
